blog.name: original-cypher
blog.title: Starting brand old.
blog.description:
Learning to let go, because when I cling, I dig in too hard and leave scars behind.
*
Alice. 31. I've survived too much to not make it though this time around too.

tags: people who don't even know who's singing get it
summary:
Colleague [singing to themselves while they work]: Only bought this dress to watch you take it off.
Me:.... 😏
Them: What? That's...
body:
Colleague [singing to themselves while they work]: Only bought this dress to watch you take it off.

Me:…. 😏

Them: What? That’s not it?

Me: Nah, nah. You got the song right.

blog.name: tswelcome2newyork
blog.title: Taylor Alison Swift
blog.description: “To me, Fearless is not the absense of fear. It's not being completely unafraid. To me, Fearless is having fears. Fearless is having doubts. Lots of them. To me, Fearless is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.” Taylor

summary:
My love had been frozen deep blue, but you painted me golden ❤️
@taylorswift I had the time of my life fighting dragons with...
body:
My love had been frozen deep blue, but you painted me golden ❤️

@taylorswift I had the time of my life fighting dragons with you!

@taylornation

blog.name: joeandtaylorfanfiction
blog.title: Fanfiction Collection
blog.description: Hey Guys! This page is a collection of all Joe and Taylor fanfiction! (These stories are not mine) Please feel free to submit a post or ask me to reblog, my inbox is always open!   One shots Series Mature Imagine's Fanfic Festival

title: Confessions - part four (Submission)
body:
Taylor closed the front door and took her jacket off, Joe doing the same thing.
As they both bent down to take their shoes off, Taylor said, “I’ll go to my brother’s room to see if I can find you something for you to change into.”
“Don’t worry about it, I’ll be fine like this” Joe told her. He didn’t want to give her any trouble.
“No, I’ll get you some clothes, come on” she insisted, straightening up and starting walking towards Austin’s room. She wasn’t about to have him dressed in outside clothes if they were just going to sit on the couch, especially when she had perfectly comfortable clothes he could wear.
Taylor opened the door and they both got in. She walked towards the dresser and opened the first drawer.
“Okay, loads of t-shirts, which one do you want?” She asked him, turning her head to see him walking in her direction.
“Whichever is fine, I don’t mind” Joe said, ending up choosing a grey one.
“Okay, now, let’s see” Taylor mumbled while closing the first drawer and opening a couple more. “Aha!” She exclaimed. “Sweatpants okay?” she asked Joe.
“Yeah, perfect” he smiled at her while grabbing the first pair on the drawer.
“Just unfold them and have a look, I think they’ll fit” Taylor said while closing the drawer.
He did as she suggested and nodded once while saying “yeah, they look like they’ll fit, don’t worry.”
“Okay, get changed and I’ll meet you in the living room in a couple of minutes” she smiled at him while leaving the room and closing the door.
Once she got to her room she noticed the cats were still lounging on her bed. “Hi guys, we have a guest, be ni-“ she stopped herself thinking about the word ‘guest’ and ended up rolling her eyes. “Gigi was right about this after all, damn her” she whispered and ended up chuckling at the irony. It was fine, she still had plenty of cookies, certainly enough for the both of them. She should ask him if he wanted some.
She went to grab the pyjamas she had on earlier but stopped herself. Should she put on something nicer? But that wouldn’t make sense, she just gave him freaking sweatpants for fuck’s sake. Her brother’s sweatpants. Ugh. What to do… she went to the drawer where she kept her sleeping clothes, opened it and stared. Definitely nothing with lace. Or silk. But she wanted a nightie.
Suddenly she remembered she had a new one somewhere, it was grey cotton, it looked a bit like an oversized t-shirt, definitely comfortable looking, definitely not too obvious, but the hemline didn’t even hit her mid tight. She’d go with that.
Once she had it on she pulled her hair up in a ponytail and walked to the living room.
Joe was already sitting on the couch, Meredith on his left side while he rubbed her tummy and Olivia on his right side while he tickled in between her ears. 
“Why do my cats like you better than me?” Taylor asked, pretending to sound outraged. 
Joe looked over at her and smirked. “They sense my pure soul” he answered, trying not to laugh.
Taylor scoffed. “Yeah, right. Do you want something to drink? Also, before I forget, I have chocolate chip cookies I baked earlier today if you want some.”
“Well, I was going to ask for some wine but since you have cookies I’ll go with some milk, please.”
Taylor laughed, “You can still have wine even if you want the cookies” she told him.
“Well, I guess, but cookies with milk is the perfect combination” Joe argued.
“I guess you’re not wrong” Taylor started walking in the direction of the kitchen. “Just wait a second and I’ll bring you some. Could you turn on the TV, please? I had started season two but I was a couple of episodes in so maybe we should start the beginning?”
“Yeah, sounds good” he reassured, picking up the remote as Taylor went into the kitchen.
When she returned with a plate of cookies and a glass of milk, Meredith and Olivia were no where in sight and Joe had season two of ‘Friends’ ready to play.
“Jesus, those look so good, I think I might drool a bit” Joe told her while looking at the cookies.
Taylor laughed then. “Don’t judge till you actually taste them, they might be terrible” she joked.
“Hm I see your point, but it’s very unlikely” he told her as he grabbed the glass and plate from her and put them on the table in front of the couch. “Everything you make is bloody brilliant” he finished, and Taylor could feel her cheeks warming up at that.
‘Ugh, I hate him’ she thought. ‘How the hell am I supposed not to like him when he’s like this.’
“Thank you” Taylor mumbled as she sat down next to him on the couch, folding her left leg underneath herself. She picked up the remote and hit ‘play’.
Joe got a cookie from the plate and took a bite, closing his eyes instantly and moaning. Taylor gave a very deep breath while chanting in her head ‘the world hates me, the world hates me, the world hates me’.
“Not wanting to be that person but” Joe started as he put the rest of the cookies in his mouth, “I totally told you so. Bloody brilliant” he complemented as he kept chewing.
Taylor cleared her throat. “Glad you like them” she said. ‘I need to do something about this’ Taylor thought, ‘so, I like him. And I need to figure out a way to tell him. Because this is torture. He’s right here. But not as much as he could be. Ugh, why did I ever tell him I just wanted to be friends. Idiot. How do I tell him… What if he’s the one who doesn’t want a relationship right now. I never really asked if-‘
“Taylor?” She turned her head to her left to look up at him.
“What?” She asked, her eyes open wide.
“I asked if you didn’t want a cookie” he told her, looking at her weird. “Are you okay?”
‘Perfect, you can tell him now’ she thought. “I… am great” she smiled at him, “was just a bit distracted” she continued, taking the cookie he was holding out for her.
He hummed and turned his head back to the TV. Taylor sighed and started chewing on the cookie, thinking some other time would have to do.
Around an hour and a half later, Taylor was cuddled on Joe’s side, her right leg across his lap, his right arm around her, his hand gently massaging her scalp, her hair tie long gone, his other hand half holding her hip.
“Is this weird” Taylor murmured only loud enough for him to hear.
She could feel him moving his neck a bit so his cheek was on top of her head.
“What is weird?” He murmured back, his fingers still doing that back and forth motion in between strands of her hair, making her want to sigh in contentment.
“We’re cuddling” she said, adjusting herself so she was now straddling his lap, resting her cheek on his chest in a way that she couldn’t even watch the TV anymore.
“I don’t think it’s weird” Joe said, adjusting his arms so he could rub a hand up and down her back and bring the other one back to her hair.
Taylor hummed. “Isn’t it though…” Taylor mumbled again. Her eyes felt heavy.
“It’s only weird if we let it be weird, I think” she could feel him kissing the top of her head. Or at least she thought so…
Taylor opened her eyes because she felt cold. She was lying down in her bed, alone. Her bedroom door wasn’t closed all the way through and she could see light coming from it. She sat up in bed. She could hear footsteps outside in the corridor so she got up.
Joe was halfway down the stairs when he heard a groggy “where are you going?”
He stoped and looked back, Taylor was at the top of the staircase looking half asleep and not completely happy, if he was going to be honest.
“I’m sorry” he said. “I tried really hard not to wake you up. I didn’t want you to wake up hurting tomorrow from sleeping in the couch all night.”
Taylor frowned her eyes. “Okay. Where are you going?” She wasn’t sure if there was a very obvious reason he seemed to be leaving and she just couldn’t think about it because she was basically sleeping while standing.
“I was going to leave” he said, slowly.
Taylor stared for a few seconds. “But why?” She asked him.
He seemed a bit uncertain. “Well, I wasn’t sure if you wanted me to stay.”
She looked a bit annoyed then. “Of course I want you to stay” she mumbled, grumpily. “I’m cold, come to bed” she practically ordered, turning around and starting to walk back to her room. He gave an incredulous chuckle and started going up the stairs again.
When he got inside her room he closed the door, noticing she was already buried in the covers on the left side of the bed, her eyes and forehead peaking from underneath, making sure he was coming. He walked around the bed to get to his side and pulled the sheets, starting to climb inside.
“What are you doing” he heard her ask, and stopped to look at her.
“Lying down” he said slowly, unsure again.
“You’re not sleeping in my bed with me with my brother’s clothes on” she told him, and he couldn’t help but laugh.
“Yes, Miss” he grinned at her and straightened up again, taking the t-shirt off and stripping off the sweats. “Better?” Joe asked her.
“Yes” Taylor told him. “Hurry up, I’m cold.”
He chuckled again, finally lying down next to her.
“Jesus, you’re freezing” he told her when she cuddled up next to him.
“Your fault, left me alone on the bed” she mumbled, breathing in the scent from his neck.
“You didn’t stay here for even a minute though” he said incredulously while pulling her even closer to him.
“Well, I’m still cold. And sleepy. Shut up.”
Joe grinned and bent down a bit to kiss her forehead. “Sleep tight, have the best dreams” he murmured.
He could feel her moving her head away from his neck and looked down to find her staring up at him. Her eyes were puffy from sleep, but she looked beautiful nonetheless.
“Kiss?” He heard her ask, seeming a bit unsure of herself.
“All the kisses” he smiled at her, running his hand up from her back, through her shoulder, towards her neck and resting it on her face, tilting it up enough so that he could kiss her on the mouth. He rested his lips on hers for a few seconds and then pecked her once, twice, three times.
“Nunight, love.” Joe said with his lips still touching hers. He kissed her cheek and she cuddled back into his neck, his hand moving back to her lower back where he rubbed soothing circles.
Whatever this was, it was growing, and Joe thought maybe it was time they properly talked about it. But for tonight he was going to enjoy his share of cuddles.
-
(Ok, this is it! Not sure if anyone is interested in why I wrote it like I wrote it but when I hear ‘Delicate’, and I feel that is what most people think too, is that “long nights with your hands up in my hair, echoes of your footsteps on the stairs, stay here honey I don’t wanna share” implies some kind of sexual encounter, so I wanted to try and write it without that just to mess around with the possibilities a bit, taking some advantage of the duality of words you know :) also the nightie is in one of Taylor’s rep magazine photos, there’s a photo of her hugging her knees looking at her left side into the camera wearing an oversized grey t-shirt (something tells me that was not her t-shirt lmao). Hope you enjoyed it, and hopefully I’ll feel inspired to write some other things soon)

‘Ugh, I hate him’ she thought. ‘How the hell am I supposed not to like him when he’s like this.’
“Thank you” Taylor mumbled as she sat down next to him on the couch, folding her left leg underneath herself. She picked up the remote and hit ‘play’.
Joe got a cookie from the plate and took a bite, closing his eyes instantly and moaning. Taylor gave a very deep breath while chanting in her head ‘the world hates me, the world hates me, the world hates me’.
“Not wanting to be that person but” Joe started as he put the rest of the cookies in his mouth, “I totally told you so. Bloody brilliant” he complemented as he kept chewing.
Taylor cleared her throat. “Glad you like them” she said. ‘I need to do something about this’ Taylor thought, ‘so, I like him. And I need to figure out a way to tell him. Because this is torture. He’s right here. But not as much as he could be. Ugh, why did I ever tell him I just wanted to be friends. Idiot. How do I tell him… What if he’s the one who doesn’t want a relationship right now. I never really asked if-‘
“Taylor?” She turned her head to her left to look up at him.
“What?” She asked, her eyes open wide.
“I asked if you didn’t want a cookie” he told her, looking at her weird. “Are you okay?”
‘Perfect, you can tell him now’ she thought. “I… am great” she smiled at him, “was just a bit distracted” she continued, taking the cookie he was holding out for her.
He hummed and turned his head back to the TV. Taylor sighed and started chewing on the cookie, thinking some other time would have to do.
Around an hour and a half later, Taylor was cuddled on Joe’s side, her right leg across his lap, his right arm around her, his hand gently massaging her scalp, her hair tie long gone, his other hand half holding her hip.
“Is this weird” Taylor murmured only loud enough for him to hear.
She could feel him moving his neck a bit so his cheek was on top of her head.
“What is weird?” He murmured back, his fingers still doing that back and forth motion in between strands of her hair, making her want to sigh in contentment.
“We’re cuddling” she said, adjusting herself so she was now straddling his lap, resting her cheek on his chest in a way that she couldn’t even watch the TV anymore.
“I don’t think it’s weird” Joe said, adjusting his arms so he could rub a hand up and down her back and bring the other one back to her hair.
Taylor hummed. “Isn’t it though…” Taylor mumbled again. Her eyes felt heavy.
“It’s only weird if we let it be weird, I think” she could feel him kissing the top of her head. Or at least she thought so…
Taylor opened her eyes because she felt cold. She was lying down in her bed, alone. Her bedroom door wasn’t closed all the way through and she could see light coming from it. She sat up in bed. She could hear footsteps outside in the corridor so she got up.
Joe was halfway down the stairs when he heard a groggy “where are you going?”
He stoped and looked back, Taylor was at the top of the staircase looking half asleep and not completely happy, if he was going to be honest.
“I’m sorry” he said. “I tried really hard not to wake you up. I didn’t want you to wake up hurting tomorrow from sleeping in the couch all night.”
Taylor frowned her eyes. “Okay. Where are you going?” She wasn’t sure if there was a very obvious reason he seemed to be leaving and she just couldn’t think about it because she was basically sleeping while standing.
“I was going to leave” he said, slowly.
Taylor stared for a few seconds. “But why?” She asked him.
He seemed a bit uncertain. “Well, I wasn’t sure if you wanted me to stay.”
She looked a bit annoyed then. “Of course I want you to stay” she mumbled, grumpily. “I’m cold, come to bed” she practically ordered, turning around and starting to walk back to her room. He gave an incredulous chuckle and started going up the stairs again.
When he got inside her room he closed the door, noticing she was already buried in the covers on the left side of the bed, her eyes and forehead peaking from underneath, making sure he was coming. He walked around the bed to get to his side and pulled the sheets, starting to climb inside.
“What are you doing” he heard her ask, and stopped to look at her.
“Lying down” he said slowly, unsure again.
“You’re not sleeping in my bed with me with my brother’s clothes on” she told him, and he couldn’t help but laugh.
“Yes, Miss” he grinned at her and straightened up again, taking the t-shirt off and stripping off the sweats. “Better?” Joe asked her.
“Yes” Taylor told him. “Hurry up, I’m cold.”
He chuckled again, finally lying down next to her.
“Jesus, you’re freezing” he told her when she cuddled up next to him.
“Your fault, left me alone on the bed” she mumbled, breathing in the scent from his neck.
“You didn’t stay here for even a minute though” he said incredulously while pulling her even closer to him.
“Well, I’m still cold. And sleepy. Shut up.”
Joe grinned and bent down a bit to kiss her forehead. “Sleep tight, have the best dreams” he murmured.
He could feel her moving her head away from his neck and looked down to find her staring up at him. Her eyes were puffy from sleep, but she looked beautiful nonetheless.
“Kiss?” He heard her ask, seeming a bit unsure of herself.
“All the kisses” he smiled at her, running his hand up from her back, through her shoulder, towards her neck and resting it on her face, tilting it up enough so that he could kiss her on the mouth. He rested his lips on hers for a few seconds and then pecked her once, twice, three times.
“Nunight, love.” Joe said with his lips still touching hers. He kissed her cheek and she cuddled back into his neck, his hand moving back to her lower back where he rubbed soothing circles.
Whatever this was, it was growing, and Joe thought maybe it was time they properly talked about it. But for tonight he was going to enjoy his share of cuddles.
-
(Ok, this is it! Not sure if anyone is interested in why I wrote it like I wrote it but when I hear ‘Delicate’, and I feel that is what most people think too, is that “long nights with your hands up in my hair, echoes of your footsteps on the stairs, stay here honey I don’t wanna share” implies some kind of sexual encounter, so I wanted to try and write it without that just to mess around with the possibilities a bit, taking some advantage of the duality of words you know :) also the nightie is in one of Taylor’s rep magazine photos, there’s a photo of her hugging her knees looking at her left side into the camera wearing an oversized grey t-shirt (something tells me that was not her t-shirt lmao). Hope you enjoyed it, and hopefully I’ll feel inspired to write some other things soon)
trail.content:
Taylor closed the front door and took her jacket off, Joe doing the same thing.
As they both bent down to take their shoes off, Taylor said, “I’ll go to my brother’s room to see if I can find you something for you to change into.”
“Don’t worry about it, I’ll be fine like this” Joe told her. He didn’t want to give her any trouble.
“No, I’ll get you some clothes, come on” she insisted, straightening up and starting walking towards Austin’s room. She wasn’t about to have him dressed in outside clothes if they were just going to sit on the couch, especially when she had perfectly comfortable clothes he could wear.
Taylor opened the door and they both got in. She walked towards the dresser and opened the first drawer.
“Okay, loads of t-shirts, which one do you want?” She asked him, turning her head to see him walking in her direction.
“Whichever is fine, I don’t mind” Joe said, ending up choosing a grey one.
“Okay, now, let’s see” Taylor mumbled while closing the first drawer and opening a couple more. “Aha!” She exclaimed. “Sweatpants okay?” she asked Joe.
“Yeah, perfect” he smiled at her while grabbing the first pair on the drawer.
“Just unfold them and have a look, I think they’ll fit” Taylor said while closing the drawer.
He did as she suggested and nodded once while saying “yeah, they look like they’ll fit, don’t worry.”
“Okay, get changed and I’ll meet you in the living room in a couple of minutes” she smiled at him while leaving the room and closing the door.
Once she got to her room she noticed the cats were still lounging on her bed. “Hi guys, we have a guest, be ni-“ she stopped herself thinking about the word ‘guest’ and ended up rolling her eyes. “Gigi was right about this after all, damn her” she whispered and ended up chuckling at the irony. It was fine, she still had plenty of cookies, certainly enough for the both of them. She should ask him if he wanted some.
She went to grab the pyjamas she had on earlier but stopped herself. Should she put on something nicer? But that wouldn’t make sense, she just gave him freaking sweatpants for fuck’s sake. Her brother’s sweatpants. Ugh. What to do… she went to the drawer where she kept her sleeping clothes, opened it and stared. Definitely nothing with lace. Or silk. But she wanted a nightie.
Suddenly she remembered she had a new one somewhere, it was grey cotton, it looked a bit like an oversized t-shirt, definitely comfortable looking, definitely not too obvious, but the hemline didn’t even hit her mid tight. She’d go with that.
Once she had it on she pulled her hair up in a ponytail and walked to the living room.
Joe was already sitting on the couch, Meredith on his left side while he rubbed her tummy and Olivia on his right side while he tickled in between her ears. 
“Why do my cats like you better than me?” Taylor asked, pretending to sound outraged. 
Joe looked over at her and smirked. “They sense my pure soul” he answered, trying not to laugh.
Taylor scoffed. “Yeah, right. Do you want something to drink? Also, before I forget, I have chocolate chip cookies I baked earlier today if you want some.”
“Well, I was going to ask for some wine but since you have cookies I’ll go with some milk, please.”
Taylor laughed, “You can still have wine even if you want the cookies” she told him.
“Well, I guess, but cookies with milk is the perfect combination” Joe argued.
“I guess you’re not wrong” Taylor started walking in the direction of the kitchen. “Just wait a second and I’ll bring you some. Could you turn on the TV, please? I had started season two but I was a couple of episodes in so maybe we should start the beginning?”
“Yeah, sounds good” he reassured, picking up the remote as Taylor went into the kitchen.
When she returned with a plate of cookies and a glass of milk, Meredith and Olivia were no where in sight and Joe had season two of ‘Friends’ ready to play.
“Jesus, those look so good, I think I might drool a bit” Joe told her while looking at the cookies.
Taylor laughed then. “Don’t judge till you actually taste them, they might be terrible” she joked.
“Hm I see your point, but it’s very unlikely” he told her as he grabbed the glass and plate from her and put them on the table in front of the couch. “Everything you make is bloody brilliant” he finished, and Taylor could feel her cheeks warming up at that.
‘Ugh, I hate him’ she thought. ‘How the hell am I supposed not to like him when he’s like this.’
“Thank you” Taylor mumbled as she sat down next to him on the couch, folding her left leg underneath herself. She picked up the remote and hit ‘play’.
Joe got a cookie from the plate and took a bite, closing his eyes instantly and moaning. Taylor gave a very deep breath while chanting in her head ‘the world hates me, the world hates me, the world hates me’.
“Not wanting to be that person but” Joe started as he put the rest of the cookies in his mouth, “I totally told you so. Bloody brilliant” he complemented as he kept chewing.
Taylor cleared her throat. “Glad you like them” she said. ‘I need to do something about this’ Taylor thought, ‘so, I like him. And I need to figure out a way to tell him. Because this is torture. He’s right here. But not as much as he could be. Ugh, why did I ever tell him I just wanted to be friends. Idiot. How do I tell him… What if he’s the one who doesn’t want a relationship right now. I never really asked if-‘
“Taylor?” She turned her head to her left to look up at him.
“What?” She asked, her eyes open wide.
“I asked if you didn’t want a cookie” he told her, looking at her weird. “Are you okay?”
‘Perfect, you can tell him now’ she thought. “I… am great” she smiled at him, “was just a bit distracted” she continued, taking the cookie he was holding out for her.
He hummed and turned his head back to the TV. Taylor sighed and started chewing on the cookie, thinking some other time would have to do.
Around an hour and a half later, Taylor was cuddled on Joe’s side, her right leg across his lap, his right arm around her, his hand gently massaging her scalp, her hair tie long gone, his other hand half holding her hip.
“Is this weird” Taylor murmured only loud enough for him to hear.
She could feel him moving his neck a bit so his cheek was on top of her head.
“What is weird?” He murmured back, his fingers still doing that back and forth motion in between strands of her hair, making her want to sigh in contentment.
“We’re cuddling” she said, adjusting herself so she was now straddling his lap, resting her cheek on his chest in a way that she couldn’t even watch the TV anymore.
“I don’t think it’s weird” Joe said, adjusting his arms so he could rub a hand up and down her back and bring the other one back to her hair.
Taylor hummed. “Isn’t it though…” Taylor mumbled again. Her eyes felt heavy.
“It’s only weird if we let it be weird, I think” she could feel him kissing the top of her head. Or at least she thought so…
Taylor opened her eyes because she felt cold. She was lying down in her bed, alone. Her bedroom door wasn’t closed all the way through and she could see light coming from it. She sat up in bed. She could hear footsteps outside in the corridor so she got up.
Joe was halfway down the stairs when he heard a groggy “where are you going?”
He stoped and looked back, Taylor was at the top of the staircase looking half asleep and not completely happy, if he was going to be honest.
“I’m sorry” he said. “I tried really hard not to wake you up. I didn’t want you to wake up hurting tomorrow from sleeping in the couch all night.”
Taylor frowned her eyes. “Okay. Where are you going?” She wasn’t sure if there was a very obvious reason he seemed to be leaving and she just couldn’t think about it because she was basically sleeping while standing.
“I was going to leave” he said, slowly.
Taylor stared for a few seconds. “But why?” She asked him.
He seemed a bit uncertain. “Well, I wasn’t sure if you wanted me to stay.”
She looked a bit annoyed then. “Of course I want you to stay” she mumbled, grumpily. “I’m cold, come to bed” she practically ordered, turning around and starting to walk back to her room. He gave an incredulous chuckle and started going up the stairs again.
When he got inside her room he closed the door, noticing she was already buried in the covers on the left side of the bed, her eyes and forehead peaking from underneath, making sure he was coming. He walked around the bed to get to his side and pulled the sheets, starting to climb inside.
“What are you doing” he heard her ask, and stopped to look at her.
“Lying down” he said slowly, unsure again.
“You’re not sleeping in my bed with me with my brother’s clothes on” she told him, and he couldn’t help but laugh.
“Yes, Miss” he grinned at her and straightened up again, taking the t-shirt off and stripping off the sweats. “Better?” Joe asked her.
“Yes” Taylor told him. “Hurry up, I’m cold.”
He chuckled again, finally lying down next to her.
“Jesus, you’re freezing” he told her when she cuddled up next to him.
“Your fault, left me alone on the bed” she mumbled, breathing in the scent from his neck.
“You didn’t stay here for even a minute though” he said incredulously while pulling her even closer to him.
“Well, I’m still cold. And sleepy. Shut up.”
Joe grinned and bent down a bit to kiss her forehead. “Sleep tight, have the best dreams” he murmured.
He could feel her moving her head away from his neck and looked down to find her staring up at him. Her eyes were puffy from sleep, but she looked beautiful nonetheless.
“Kiss?” He heard her ask, seeming a bit unsure of herself.
“All the kisses” he smiled at her, running his hand up from her back, through her shoulder, towards her neck and resting it on her face, tilting it up enough so that he could kiss her on the mouth. He rested his lips on hers for a few seconds and then pecked her once, twice, three times.
“Nunight, love.” Joe said with his lips still touching hers. He kissed her cheek and she cuddled back into his neck, his hand moving back to her lower back where he rubbed soothing circles.
Whatever this was, it was growing, and Joe thought maybe it was time they properly talked about it. But for tonight he was going to enjoy his share of cuddles.
-

Not sure if anyone is interested in why I wrote it like I wrote it but when I hear ‘Delicate’, and I feel that is what most people think too, is that “long nights with your hands up in my hair, echoes of your footsteps on the stairs, stay here honey I don’t wanna share” implies some kind of sexual encounter, so I wanted to try and write it without that just to mess around with the possibilities a bit, taking some advantage of the duality of words you know :) also the nightie is in one of Taylor’s rep magazine photos, there’s a photo of her hugging her knees looking at her left side into the camera wearing an oversized grey t-shirt (something tells me that was not her t-shirt lmao).
